content: claudia donnelly designs vanilla fingerless mitts a snap to make in worsted weight yarn these are plain vanilla mitts good for the beginner and the experienced knitter looking for a quick knit easy to make they make great gifts i have rewritten this free pattern realizing i made the original very early on in my designing career there were many mistakes and its time i fixed them for you *written instructions* copyrighted © 2021 claudia donnelly designs page 1 claudia donnelly designs difficulty beginner these mitts are knit are very simple to make and a good pattern for beginners and experts alike i have many over 20 pairs of these mitts in 2 holiday seasons you only need to know how to knit purl and make stitches construction these mitts are made from the bottom cuff up increases are used to make the thumb gusset yarn samples were knit with malabrigo worsted and malabrigo rios yarn needles mitts are knit on us size 8 yardage approximately 165 yds vanilla fingerless mitts cuff and wrist co 40 stitches begin with 10 rounds of k2 p2 ribbing knit 35 rounds thumb gusset round 1 - knit 17 sts then place a marker m1 by making a backwards loop k1 m1 place a marker round 2 - knit the next round round 3 - knit until you come to the marker slip the marker m1 knit to the next marker m1 you should now have 5 stitches between both markers round 4 knit the next round repeat rounds 3 and 4 until you have 13 stitches between both markers copyrighted © 2021 claudia donnelly designs page 2 claudia donnelly designs next round knit until you come to the marker slip the marker m1 knit to next marker m1 you should now have 15 stitches between the markers knit the next full round knitting the next round when you come to the marker remove it using a tapestry needle place the next 15 stitches on scrap yarn remove the last marker m1 using the backward loop method finish the round you should have 15 stitches on the scrap yarn for your thumb and 40 stitches on your needles hand knit 8 rounds and finish with 5 more rounds of k2 p2 ribbing bind off return to thumb gusset pick up the 15 stitches and place on needles you will be picking up and creating 5 stitches in the space between the thumb and fore finger i knit on 2 circulars so i ll tell you how i do it i pick up and place 10 of the front stitches on my 1st needle this leaves 2 stitches on one side and 3 on the other on the 2nd needle in the back i pick up 2 stitches left on one side make 5 stitches in the back then pick up the last 3 stitches on the other side of the ones i just made after picking up the 15 stitches and making the additional
